level.text: Except as otherwise provided in this subtitle, an applicant shall furnish proof satisfactory to the Board, in accordance with ยง 504(b) of the Act, (D.C. Official Code ยง 3-1205.04(b)) (2006 Supp.), that the applicant has met the following requirements:

Has successfully completed two (2) years of education at the baccalaureate level at a college or university accredited at the time of the applicant’s attendance by the Secretary of the United States Department of Education or the Council on Postsecondary Education; and
Has graduated from an educational program in the practice of chiropractic that:
Consists of four (4) academic years of study;
Includes five hundred (500) hours of practical clinical experience under the supervision of a chiropractor; and
Is accredited at the time of the applicant’s graduation by:
The Council on Chiropractic Education (CCE); or
The Straight Chiropractic Academic Standards Association (SCASA); or
Any other specialized chiropractic accrediting agency listed with the U.S. Department of Education.
An applicant shall submit with a completed application a certified transcript from educational institution(s) to the Board.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 35 DCR 6658, 6659 (September 2, 1988); as amended by Final Rulemaking published at 37 DCR 2747, 2750 (May 4, 1990); as amended by Final Rulemaking published at 50 DCR 3955 (May 23, 2003); as amended by Final Rulemaking published at 55 DCR 7937, 7938 (July 25, 2008).
